meanings.definition: A loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The chout of the child could be heard across the playground.
meanings.sent2: I heard a chout from the other room, and I knew my brother was in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The chout of the monkey startled the visitors at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the chaos, her chout for help pierced through the noise.
meanings.sent5: The chout of the referee signaled the end of the game.

meanings.definition: To utter a loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: She chouted for her lost dog until her voice grew hoarse.
meanings.sent2: The coach chouted instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The toddler chouted happily when she saw her favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: He chouted his frustration into the empty room, hoping for relief.
meanings.sent5: The singer chouted the high notes with passion and emotion.

meanings.definition: A sudden burst of sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The chout of thunder made the children jump in surprise.
meanings.sent2: The chout of laughter filled the room as friends shared jokes.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected chout of the car horn made him spill his coffee.
meanings.sent4: The chout of fireworks lit up the night sky in celebration.
meanings.sent5: The chout of the alarm clock woke her up abruptly in the morning.
